newsitem.title: USA: U.S. June trade gap narrows sharply as imports drop.
newsitem.headline: U.S. June trade gap narrows sharply as imports drop.

text.p: The U.S. trade gap narrowed dramatically in June as imports of merchandise and petroleum plunged from May levels, the Commerce Department said Tuesday.
The monthly deficit dropped 23.1 percent to $8.11 billion from a revised $10.55 billion in May -- much lower than the $9.4 billion shortfall that Wall Street economists had forecast for June.
June exports eased a slight 0.3 percent to $69.71 billion while imports dropped 3.3 percent to $77.82 billion.
